result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Jorge R Fragoso in court, defendant Jose Alberto Lopez not in court, in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's appearance waived.  This matter is adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Br  45.  Court advised parties all pre trial documents must be filed 48 hours prior to final pretrial date.  mn  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jorge R Fragoso in court, defendant Jose Alberto Lopez not in court, in custody.  Alicia Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendants appearance waived.  The Defense is requesting an additional status to allow for a report from Investigator.  With no objection from the State, the Court will allow  one additional status.   Case remains calendared in Br 45.  mn  Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room 502 SB

records.addlTxt: Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Rothstein.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Yamahiro, Br. 34.

Defendant Jose Alberto Lopez in court by video with Attorney Jorge R Fragoso who appears in person.  Defendant Jose Alberto Lopez in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Daniel Lopez.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 34, Judge Yamahiro. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 34.  Livestream link for next court date:

https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/ed5b9ae0-0153-fff4-9924-88d8db5a37c1  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.
No contact order signed and filed.

4:46PM Defendant Jose Alberto Lopez in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Defendant Jose Alberto Lopez in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jose Alberto Lopez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
